content.query:
-- 1. switch to use woca_ldw
USE woca_ldw
GO 

--1a. perform join on family family membership and family
SELECT 
    i.*, fm.*, f.*
FROM silver.vw_individual i
LEFT JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
LEFT JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family);



--1b count items you have joined 
SELECT 
    COUNT(1) AS totals
FROM silver.vw_individual i
LEFT JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
LEFT JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family);


-- 1c. count how many individuals/family were assigned a primart contact
SELECT
    f.primary_contact,
    COUNT(1) AS totals
FROM silver.vw_individual i
JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family)
GROUP BY f.primary_contact
ORDER BY totals DESC;

-- 2c. remove the null values
SELECT
    f.primary_contact,
    COUNT(1) AS totals
FROM silver.vw_individual i
JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family)
WHERE f.primary_contact IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY f.primary_contact
ORDER BY totals DESC;


--3c get the distinct counts of individuals/family were assigned primart contacts
SELECT
    DISTINCT(COUNT(1)) AS primary_contact_assi
FROM silver.vw_individual i
JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family)
WHERE f.primary_contact IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY f.primary_contact
ORDER BY totals DESC;

--1d count the number of individuals that belong to each family relationship
--Qn: where is the dict for (family_relationship)
SELECT
    fm.family_relationship,
    COUNT(1) AS totals
FROM silver.vw_individual i
JOIN silver.vw_family_membership fm ON (i.individual_id = fm.individual)
JOIN silver.vw_family f ON (f.family_id = fm.family)
GROUP BY fm.family_relationship
ORDER BY totals DESC;
